page.title: 12Local History
page.content: A Roman road ran througn Stratton and that is why the village is called Stratton on the Fosse.Stratton comes from the word which meand flat stone and Fosse means a ditch. A railway used to run through Chilcompton.Trains went from Bath to Bournemouth.The line closed in 1966 but there is still a blocked off tunnel and some bridges left. The area used to be a busy coal mining place and most of the people who lived in the villages worked at the mines. The mine closed in 1968.The miners had to find other jobs or,the older ones retired.There are a lot of old miners still living in the villages.They still get free coal from the National Coal Board.Some of them have collecions of old mining lamps.There is a very big coal tip in the area.
